name: Introduction to Astronomy
description: This course introduces students to basic astronomical concepts including celestial mechanics, stellar evolution, and star formation.

name: Introductory Physics of the Solar System and Beyond
description: This course examines the physics of the solar system, including the origin and evolution of the sun and planets, and their interactions with the interstellar medium.

name: Planetary Geology
description: This course explores the geological history of the solar system, including the formation and evolution of the planets, asteroids and comets.
prerequisites: Introductory Physics of the Solar System and Beyond

name: Extrasolar Planets
description: This course covers the study of planets around other stars, including their formation, evolution, and habitability.
prerequisites: Introductory Physics of the Solar System and Beyond

name: Origin and Evolution of Life in the Universe
description: This course introduces students to the study of Astrobiology, including the origin of life, the evolution of life on Earth, and the search for life outside of Earth.
